location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 37 from William Newnham, Chief Secretary to the Government, Political Department, Bombay to Ephraim Gerrish Stannus, Resident in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: The letter is acknowledging a communication sent by the Resident, dated 1 December 1825. In response, it states that the Governor of Bombay approves of the Resident's handling of the enquiries of the Chieftain Sooltan bin Suggur [Sulṭān bin Saqr]. It further explains the British policy of neutrality concerning the conquests of the Wahabee [Wahhabi] on the Arabian side of the Persian Gulf.
